general_advisory: During rainy season conduct regular health checks on livestock to identify any signs of stress or illness early. Ensure a clean and adequate water supply, avoiding stagnant water which can be a breeding ground for pathogens. Regularly check water sources for contamination and maintain proper hygiene.

advisory: Blister beetles feed on the flowers and reduce the number of pods setting, affecting crop yield. To manage, manually collect insects and put them in kerosene or cover them in a pit with soil.

There are chances of sucking pests like Aphids, Jassids, Thrips, and Whiteflies in vegetables due to present weather conditions. To manage pests, spray neem-based pesticide early on. Install Yellow sticky traps per acre. Chemical spray alternatives include Thiamethoxam, Acetamiprid, Fenobucarb, or Tolfenpyrad.
Apply Emamectin benzoate or spinosad to control Fruit and Shoot borer in Okra.
To control Red Pumpkin Beetle in Cucurbit crops, spray Cyantraniliprole, Imidacloprid, or Chlorpyrifos.
For Cauliflower, cabbage, and Broccoli, use specific seed rates for improved varieties and hybrid seeds. Prepare nursery beds with appropriate dimensions and apply compost before sowing.
